meanings.definition: A sound made by a spring or elastic object when it is compressed and then released.
meanings.sent1: The boing of the door spring startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud boing when the rubber band snapped.
meanings.sent3: The boing of the trampoline brought a smile to my face.
meanings.sent4: The boing of the jack-in-the-box always surprises me.
meanings.sent5: The boing echoed through the room, making everyone jump.

meanings.definition: To make a springing or bouncing motion.
meanings.sent1: The ball will boing when you drop it.
meanings.sent2: I love to watch the rubber ball boing on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The frog began to boing around the pond happily.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to boing with joy at the good news.
meanings.sent5: The kangaroo can boing high in the air with ease.

meanings.sent1: The party had a fun boing to it.
meanings.sent2: Her laughter added a cheerful boing to the room.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful boing was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The music had a lively boing that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent5: The children's excitement had a joyful boing in the air.
